title: Multiple fixes and refactoring
body:
I removed the new `isMixed` parameter which also fixes issue #102 and used the `mar` parameter instead.
This way, the issue #102 is fixed and we don't have to extend the already huge API of `corrplot`.

Additionally in this pull request:
- Fixed issues #94, #96 and perhaps others when the "upper" matrix is rendered with `t.pos="n"`.
- Also added some more examples to the vignette.
- Refactored some rendering code to separate pure functions. We will refactor the `corrplot` functional hopefully in future.

title: fixes issue #70
body:
As a part of the fix, I had to refactor three IF statements into an if-elseif-else statement.
The goal is to cover all possible cases of 0/+/- values of `min` and `max` in the `corr` matrix.

I think the code is now cleaner and more explicit about all the possible combinations that might appear.
I also think that the new implementation does not break backwards compatibility.
However, please test it on some well known datasets before merging into the upstream.
The current unit tests cannot reveal this in an automated way yet.

title: Set/reset par() no matter if add = TRUE or FALSE

title: Restore par() settings on exit
body: You changed `par('mar')` but didn't restore it. It is always good practice to restore `par()` before the function exits. This fixes #17.

title: Continuous integration and static code analysis
body:
- added support for Travis-CI
- added first unit-test (just to prove that one of my refactorings is equivalent to the original code)
- added support for static code analysis and code style checking using `lintr` (see also the automatically generated commit comment from lintr-bot here https://github.com/vsimko/corrplot/commit/8e9fd612ce5f32da05ffd6472bd0b26d721e4090#commitcomment-16385761)
- some minor refactoring within the function (there is a lot of spaghetti-code that will need refactoring)

repo.description: Package corrplot is for visualizing a correlation matrix
repo.name: corrplot

title: Automated generation of documentation using roxygen
body:
- I moved the content from manually written `Rd` files to doc-comments.
- NAMESPACE file is now generated automatically using roxygen from `@export` tags
- `man/*.Rd` files are generated automatically
- Examples are refactored into separate files inside `vignettes` directory
- `R CMD check` now passes without any warning/notes/errors
- This way, I found some parameters documented in `corrRect` function that were actually moved to `corrRect.hclust` function.

title: Add parameters to control visual display of correlation coefficients
body:
The following parameters were added to the `corrplot` function:
- `number.cex`: Controls text size of correlation coefficients
- `number.font`: Controls the font used to print the correlation coefficients

title: Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md
body:
### taiyun/corrplot now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@taiyun has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/taiyun/corrplot](https://gitter.im/taiyun/corrplot?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).

This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:

[![Gitter](https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/taiyun/corrplot?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=body_badge)

If my aim is a little off, please [let me know](https://github.com/gitterHQ/readme-badger/issues).

Happy chatting.

PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

title: 你不需要corrplot-intro.R
body: `R CMD build`会自动生成一份代码，平时你应该先`R CMD build corrplot`然后再`R CMD INSTALL corrplot_*.tar.gz`。

title: fix the vignette problem
body:
- need `library(knitr)` in Rmd
- no need to use the `Cairo` package anymore
- the Makefile is for backward compatibility with R 2.15.x

title: build R Markdown vignettes under R 3.0.0
body:
- the old trick of `Makefile` + `fake Rnw` is no longer necessary
- need to specify the vignette builder `knitr` in `DESCRIPTION`
- the `Rmd` vignette does not have to be named as `index.Rmd` (actually it is not recommended to do so)
